critique: This document is an executive order that delays certain transfers, consolidations, and eliminations related to economy as provided for under section 4 of Executive Order No. 6166 of June 10, 1933. It pertains to the function of disbursement now exercised by United States Marshals under the Department of Justice. Given the limited scope and focus on internal government operations, the document's ideological tilt is neutral. There is no mention of immigration, executive power changes, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. The document seems to be focused on economic regulation by delaying certain transfers, consolidations, and eliminations.
